alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 5:40PM ChST until August 31 at 8:30PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Entirety of Guam... * Until 830 PM ChST. * At 540 PM ChST, Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain across Guam. Reports of cars underwater in Harmon and significant flooding in Tumon, Pleasure Island area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Satellite estimates and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...SATELLITE AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
